name: electric kettle production | electric kettle | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/21247/documentation

This activity represents the production and disposal of an average electric kettle which is approximately 1.5 kg in mass. It has the envisaged lifetime of 4 years and is manufactured in Europe. The figures on material inputs from technosphere and electricity required to produce an average electric kettle are taken from Marcinkowski and Zych 2017. The figure on the annual production volume is assumed to be equal to the annual amount of kettle sales as taken from Bounds 2017. 

This activity starts with the reception of materials at the factory

The activity includes the processes of material and energy use in manufacturing an average electric kettle. The inventory additionally accounts for disposal of all materials. Packaging is not included.
category: C:Manufacturing/27:Manufacture of electrical equipment/275:Manufacture of domestic appliances/2750:Manufacture of domestic appliances

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The literature sources used refer to primary data from 2014. The end period is assumed to be 2017, the year when the study was published, which represents current technology.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Geography GLO was chosen because the dataset aims to represent the production of an average electric kettle. The literature sources used refer to manufacturing in Europe.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The literature sources used refer to manufacturing in Europe.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The annual production volume of electric kettles is assumed to equate to the annual volume of sales which is 174 million units (Bounds 2017). For electricity required to manufacture an electric kettle, convertion of kJ into kWh is made assuming 1 kWh = 3.6 MJ. Likewise, convertion of liters of compressed air to m3 is made. The amount of scrap steel produced is assumed to be equal to the amount of stainless steel and regular steel used in kettle manufacturing. The amount of scrap copper includes the amount of scrap brass and scrap chromium.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Manufacturing data are taken from Mascinkowski and Zych 2017. Data on the annual production volume are taken from Bounds 2017. Sources: Marcinkowski, A., and Zych, K., 2017. Environmental performance of kettle production: Product Life Cycle Assessment. Management Systems in Production Engineering, 25(4), 255-261. Bounds, A., 2017. Kettle safety control company to list in UK. Financial Times, 25 July 2017. Available from: https://www.ft.com/content/4918a718-711b-11e7-aca6-c6bd07df1a3c (Accessed 20 January 2018).

exchanges.description: Used here in place of infrastructure based on the amount of the largest contributor to the final product mass (polypropylene). This is an estimated value. According to the technology comment of the dataset 'Plastic processing factory construction, GLO' [accessed 19.01.2018], the life time of the tanks is assumed to be 50 years and the annual production is 27000 t/a. Thus, the estimated lifetime output of the factory is 27000 x 50 = 1350000. As the coffee machine mass is 1.5 kg, then the number of coffee machines produced during the lifetime of the factory is 1350000 / 0.0015 = 900000000 units. The calculation of the infrastructure is therefore 1/life time capacity = 1/900000000 unit.
